suppress.notes: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-1258 False positive -- we do not use Spring Framework 5.0.5.RELEASE (5.0.8.RELEASE at the time of writing) Additionally, we do not use Spring method security annotations which are the specific vulnerability
Suppressing because application is not exposed to browser and we do not use jsession parameter https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-5421
We do not use vulnerable OpenId functionality https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2007-1651 https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2007-1652

We do not use authority component to derive host name latest library version has the problem too https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.httpcomponents/httpclient more details https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13956
It is vulnerability discovered in spring oauth2 module in transitive dependency (ignore for now) more details https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-29242
It is vulnerability discovered in spring oauth2 module in transitive dependency (ignore for now) more details https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-29243
It is vulnerability discovered in spring oauth2 module in transitive dependency (ignore for now) more details https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-29244
